title: The Launch: Fashion News to Know This October
excerpt: Read our roundup of the best fashion news, launches, and happenings this month to stay sartorially informed.
text: Ganni and Barbour Drop Third Collectioncourtesy of GanniWho: Ganni and BarbourWhat: Collaborative collectionWhere: Online at ganni.com and barbour.com along with select retail stores starting October 30Why: On the heels of two successful collaborations, Ganni and Barbour have teamed up for a third time. The new nine-piece collection features the signature outerwear silhouettes and styles of Barbour with added design elements from the cult-favorite Danish label. We’ll take one of everything, please.Lafayette 148 Collaborates With Save VeniceCredit: Courtesy of Lafayette148Who: Lafayette 148 and Save VeniceWhat: Capsule collectionWhere: Online at lafayette148.com Why: Lafayette 148 has partnered with Save Venice on a new capsule collection to help preserve and restore the works of historic female artists (from Venice, naturally). The initiative will benefit the nonprofit’s “Women Artists of Venice Program,” and takes inspiration from the artist Giulia Lama and her early 18th-century painting “Virgin in Prayer.” The New York-based brand reimagined the work by utilizing its colors and tones in luxe velvet.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowLoretta Caponi and Carlos Mota Unveil Capsule CollectionCredit: Courtesy of Loretta CaponiWho: Loretta Caponi and Carlos MotaWhat: Capsule collectionWhere: Online at lorettacaponi.comWhy: Loretta Caponi is joining forces with interior designer Carlos Mota on new capsule inspired by art, nature, and lifestyle. Within the collection are bed linens, placemats, napkins, and towels that combine Mota’s love of art and nature with Caponi’s finely crafted linens. Proceeds will benefit Conservation International, an environmental organization that helps conserve wildlife.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowOTW By Vans and HommeGirls Partner on First-Ever CapsuleGrace AhlbomWho: OTW by Vans and HommeGirlsWhat: Capsule collectionWhere: Online at otw.vans.com Why: OTW by Vans has partnered with HommeGirls on a first-of-its-kind capsule collection. The focus? The intersection between skating and style, naturally. Among the six pieces are checkerboard-print boxer shorts, tank tops, T-shirts, and fresh takes on signature OTW by Vans styles, like the OTW Sk8-Mid 83.Miu Miu Unveils New Exhibition at Art Basel ParisCourtesy of Miu MiuWho: Miu Miu What: Exhibition openingWhere: Art Basel Paris Why: Miu Miu has officially announced its presence and partnership at Art Basel Paris. The brand’s immersive exhibition, “Tales & Tellers,” focuses on the importance of storytelling, with short films, performances, panel conversations, and guided tours.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowJacquemus Touches Down in New York City Courtesy of JacquemusWho: Jacquemus What: First New York boutique openingWhere: 143 Spring Street, New York City Why: At long last, Jacquemus has descended on NYC. The brand’s new 3,000-square-foot store is located inside a townhouse in the heart of Soho. Inside, customers are transported straight to Provence, a place deeply tied to designer Simon Porte Jacquemus. In case you aren’t able to make it there to shop IRL, this bag, pair of mules, and dress are all editor-approved.Polo Ralph Lauren Partners With the New York Yankees on Capsule Collection Credit: Courtesy of Polo Ralph LaurenWho: Polo Ralph Lauren and the New York YankeesWhat: Capsule collectionWhere: Online at ralphlauren.com Why: Just in time for the playoffs, Polo Ralph Lauren has once again teamed up the New York Yankees on a special capsule collection. This latest drop will include sweaters emblazoned with bears in pinstripes, a leather jacket, and hoodie. Shop it before it inevitably sells out. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowMalone Souliers Taps Tabitha Simmons for Second CollaborationWho: Malone Souliers and Tabitha SimmonsWhat: Shoe collaborationWhere: Online at malonesouliers.com and bergdorfgoodman.comWhy: U.K.-based shoe brand Malone Souliers has teamed up with Tabitha Simmons once again—this time, on a new capsule inspired by “British heritage and modern twists,” according to a press release. With fall-friendly silhouettes and playful details (like these linen sandals with gold and silver stud embellishments), the collection is made for transitional dressing. FoundRae Opens First L.A. Store Courtesy of FoundRaeAdvertisement - Continue Reading BelowGiorgio Armani Unveils Madison Avenue Flagship in New York City Courtesy of Giorgio ArmaniWho: Giorgio ArmaniWhat: New flagship openingWhere: New York CityWhy: Giorgio Armani has opened its newest U.S. flagship on Madison Avenue in New York City. The 12-story building includes boutiques, residences, and a soon-to-be-open restaurant. Beautifully crafted with Armani’s signature home and ready-to-wear pieces, the space perfectly reflects the designer’s aesthetic. Diane von Furstenberg Exhibition Opens in Los AngelesHalban PhotographyWho: Diane von FurstenbergWhat: Exhibition openingWhere: The Skirball Cultural Center in Los Angeles through Aug. 31, 2025Why: DVF is headed to the West Coast. A new retrospective on the legendary designer, titled “Woman Before Fashion,” catalogues her incredible life from the 1970s to present day, including her personal history as the daughter of a Holocaust survivor as well as the creation of her now-iconic wrap dress. Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowEtro and Wolford Unveil Newest Capsule CollectionWho: Etro and WolfordWhat: Collaborative collectionWhere: Online at etro.com and wolford.com, in Etro and Wolford boutiques, and at select retailers worldwide. Why: Etro and Wolford have joined forces on a collection of body-hugging pieces featuring the former’s signature bold prints. Bodysuits, tights, leggings, and dresses are done in Wolford’s sheer and stretchy silhouettes, with three exclusive motifs: Paisley Tattoo, Paisley Baroque, and Metallic Jacquard. Solange Azagury-Partridge Pens New BookNow 24% OffCredit: Courtesy of RizzoliWho: Solange Azagury-PartridgeWhat: New book releaseWhere: Online at amazon.com and walmart.comWhy: Rizzoli has tapped London-based jeweler Solange Azagury-Partridge to showcase her work from the past 35 years in a brand-new book. The pages are filled with the designer’s creations, known for their bold and explosive hues and themes.Advertisement - Continue Reading BelowG-Star and Ottolinger Team Up on New CollectionCredit: Courtesy of G-StarProsConsWho: G-Star and OttolingerWhat: Collaborative collectionWhere: Online at g-star.com and ottolinger.com Why: G-Star has announced “The Denim,” a new series where the brand selects guest designers on limited-edition releases. First up is Berlin-based label Ottolinger, founded by Christa Bösch and Cosima Gadient. For the collab, the duo focused on G-Star’s signature Elwood style, re-interpreting the original details such as knee pads and stitching. Aviator Nation Collaborates With SNLCredit: Courtesy of Aviator NationWho: Aviator Nation and Saturday Night Live What: Collaborative collectionWhere: Exclusively online at nbcstore.com Why: To celebrate Saturday Night Live’s 50th anniversary, the hit late-night show is collaborating with Aviator Nation on a limited-edition capsule collection. The offering includes hoodies, tees, and hats displaying vintage logos tying into SNL’s longstanding history. Grab your vintage-inspired merch while it’s still in stock.Carson Stannard is a freelance fashion associate at ELLE Magazine covering all things fashion, accessories, and trends.
html:
Ganni and Barbour Drop Third Collection

Who: Ganni and Barbour

What: Collaborative collection

Where: Online at ganni.com and barbour.com along with select retail stores starting October 30

Why: On the heels of two successful collaborations, Ganni and Barbour have teamed up for a third time. The new nine-piece collection features the signature outerwear silhouettes and styles of Barbour with added design elements from the cult-favorite Danish label. We’ll take one of everything, please.

Lafayette 148 Collaborates With Save Venice

Who: Lafayette 148 and Save Venice

What: Capsule collection

Where: Online at lafayette148.com

Why: Lafayette 148 has partnered with Save Venice on a new capsule collection to help preserve and restore the works of historic female artists (from Venice, naturally). The initiative will benefit the nonprofit’s “Women Artists of Venice Program,” and takes inspiration from the artist Giulia Lama and her early 18th-century painting “Virgin in Prayer.” The New York-based brand reimagined the work by utilizing its colors and tones in luxe velvet.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Loretta Caponi and Carlos Mota Unveil Capsule Collection

Who: Loretta Caponi and Carlos Mota

What: Capsule collection

Where: Online at lorettacaponi.com

Why: Loretta Caponi is joining forces with interior designer Carlos Mota on new capsule inspired by art, nature, and lifestyle. Within the collection are bed linens, placemats, napkins, and towels that combine Mota’s love of art and nature with Caponi’s finely crafted linens.

The RealReal Hosts a Celebrity Closet Sale

Who: The RealReal

What: Closet sale

Where: Online at therealreal.com

Why: The RealReal is back with another A-list closet sale—this time, featuring over 230 pieces from the closets of Kate Moss, Julianne Moore, and Parker Posey (to name just a few). Proceeds will benefit Conservation International, an environmental organization that helps conserve wildlife.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

OTW By Vans and HommeGirls Partner on First-Ever Capsule

Who: OTW by Vans and HommeGirls

What: Capsule collection

Where: Online at otw.vans.com

Why: OTW by Vans has partnered with HommeGirls on a first-of-its-kind capsule collection. The focus? The intersection between skating and style, naturally. Among the six pieces are checkerboard-print boxer shorts, tank tops, T-shirts, and fresh takes on signature OTW by Vans styles, like the OTW Sk8-Mid 83.

Miu Miu Unveils New Exhibition at Art Basel Paris

Who: Miu Miu

What: Exhibition opening

Where: Art Basel Paris

Why: Miu Miu has officially announced its presence and partnership at Art Basel Paris. The brand’s immersive exhibition, “Tales & Tellers,” focuses on the importance of storytelling, with short films, performances, panel conversations, and guided tours.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Jacquemus Touches Down in New York City

Who: Jacquemus

What: First New York boutique opening

Where: 143 Spring Street, New York City

Why: At long last, Jacquemus has descended on NYC. The brand’s new 3,000-square-foot store is located inside a townhouse in the heart of Soho. Inside, customers are transported straight to Provence, a place deeply tied to designer Simon Porte Jacquemus. In case you aren’t able to make it there to shop IRL, this bag, pair of mules, and dress are all editor-approved.

Polo Ralph Lauren Partners With the New York Yankees on Capsule Collection

Who: Polo Ralph Lauren and the New York Yankees

What: Capsule collection

Where: Online at ralphlauren.com

Why: Just in time for the playoffs, Polo Ralph Lauren has once again teamed up the New York Yankees on a special capsule collection. This latest drop will include sweaters emblazoned with bears in pinstripes, a leather jacket, and hoodie. Shop it before it inevitably sells out.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Malone Souliers Taps Tabitha Simmons for Second Collaboration

Who: Malone Souliers and Tabitha Simmons

What: Shoe collaboration

Where: Online at malonesouliers.com and bergdorfgoodman.com

Why: U.K.-based shoe brand Malone Souliers has teamed up with Tabitha Simmons once again—this time, on a new capsule inspired by “British heritage and modern twists,” according to a press release. With fall-friendly silhouettes and playful details (like these linen sandals with gold and silver stud embellishments), the collection is made for transitional dressing.

FoundRae Opens First L.A. Store

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Giorgio Armani Unveils Madison Avenue Flagship in New York City

Who: Giorgio Armani

What: New flagship opening

Where: New York City

Why: Giorgio Armani has opened its newest U.S. flagship on Madison Avenue in New York City. The 12-story building includes boutiques, residences, and a soon-to-be-open restaurant. Beautifully crafted with Armani’s signature home and ready-to-wear pieces, the space perfectly reflects the designer’s aesthetic.

Diane von Furstenberg Exhibition Opens in Los Angeles

Who: Diane von Furstenberg

What: Exhibition opening

Where: The Skirball Cultural Center in Los Angeles through Aug. 31, 2025

Why: DVF is headed to the West Coast. A new retrospective on the legendary designer, titled “Woman Before Fashion,” catalogues her incredible life from the 1970s to present day, including her personal history as the daughter of a Holocaust survivor as well as the creation of her now-iconic wrap dress.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

Etro and Wolford Unveil Newest Capsule Collection

Who: Etro and Wolford

What: Collaborative collection

Where: Online at etro.com and wolford.com, in Etro and Wolford boutiques, and at select retailers worldwide.

Why: Etro and Wolford have joined forces on a collection of body-hugging pieces featuring the former’s signature bold prints. Bodysuits, tights, leggings, and dresses are done in Wolford’s sheer and stretchy silhouettes, with three exclusive motifs: Paisley Tattoo, Paisley Baroque, and Metallic Jacquard.

Solange Azagury-Partridge Pens New Book

Now 24% Off

Who: Solange Azagury-Partridge

What: New book release

Where: Online at amazon.com and walmart.com

Why: Rizzoli has tapped London-based jeweler Solange Azagury-Partridge to showcase her work from the past 35 years in a brand-new book. The pages are filled with the designer’s creations, known for their bold and explosive hues and themes.

Advertisement - Continue Reading Below

G-Star and Ottolinger Team Up on New Collection

Pros
    Cons

    Who: G-Star and Ottolinger

    What: Collaborative collection

    Where: Online at g-star.com and ottolinger.com

    Why: G-Star has announced “The Denim,” a new series where the brand selects guest designers on limited-edition releases. First up is Berlin-based label Ottolinger, founded by Christa Bösch and Cosima Gadient. For the collab, the duo focused on G-Star’s signature Elwood style, re-interpreting the original details such as knee pads and stitching.

    Aviator Nation Collaborates With SNL

    Who: Aviator Nation and Saturday Night Live

    What: Collaborative collection

    Where: Exclusively online at nbcstore.com

    Why: To celebrate Saturday Night Live’s 50th anniversary, the hit late-night show is collaborating with Aviator Nation on a limited-edition capsule collection. The offering includes hoodies, tees, and hats displaying vintage logos tying into SNL’s longstanding history. Grab your vintage-inspired merch while it’s still in stock.

    Carson Stannard is a freelance fashion associate at ELLE Magazine covering all things fashion, accessories, and trends.
